Harmony, as a musical term, doesn't mean that the result always sounds euphonic & soothing.

snippet.textDisplay: Quite. The D2 Tristram music is great, but it's a very different style to this, which is about depth rather than melody. If all you're hearing is repeated strings then you're not listening at all.
snippet.textOriginal: Quite. The D2 Tristram music is great, but it's a very different style to this, which is about depth rather than melody. If all you're hearing is repeated strings then you're not listening at all.

snippet.textDisplay:
the loop is only for the strings, the basic layer of the music .
This is something like the bolero de ravel , it begins low with one layer , the staccato strings (  the first loop  ) , and loop after loop there are layers of additional instruments, and rise toward the climax.
The evolution is slow by purpose, this is a slow building.

This is a different composition, not the same  than tristan theme.
snippet.textOriginal:
the loop is only for the strings, the basic layer of the music .
This is something like the bolero de ravel , it begins low with one layer , the staccato strings (  the first loop  ) , and loop after loop there are layers of additional instruments, and rise toward the climax.
The evolution is slow by purpose, this is a slow building.

This is a different composition, not the same  than tristan theme.

snippet.textDisplay: +doumekikun the music is generic, keep repeating the same loop with occasional variations.  Boring. Can not even be compared with Tristram soundtrack. snippet.textDisplay:
When running around below a city under siege by an Arch Angel of Death it fits surprisingly well.
I'd almost go as far as to say that when I heard this song, it was the first time I actually thought to myself that "I really need to save this town, these people, the WORLD from the evil!"

I know I've already paid for the expansion, but Blizzard, take my money once again!
snippet.textOriginal:
When running around below a city under siege by an Arch Angel of Death it fits surprisingly well.
I'd almost go as far as to say that when I heard this song, it was the first time I actually thought to myself that "I really need to save this town, these people, the WORLD from the evil!"

I know I've already paid for the expansion, but Blizzard, take my money once again!

snippet.textDisplay: Diablo III was such a good time until I hit level 60 and was spending more time on the Auction House than ingame. I haven't played since the end of 2012 and since I'm weak when it comes to the Diablo series, I bought this expansion and I'll start playing in a couple minutes (continuing my Witch Doctor). No more Auction House, smarter loot drops and new gameplay elements are very welcome and it makes me excited for it. We'll see how it goes!
snippet.textOriginal: Diablo III was such a good time until I hit level 60 and was spending more time on the Auction House than ingame. I haven't played since the end of 2012 and since I'm weak when it comes to the Diablo series, I bought this expansion and I'll start playing in a couple minutes (continuing my Witch Doctor). No more Auction House, smarter loot drops and new gameplay elements are very welcome and it makes me excited for it. We'll see how it goes!

snippet.textDisplay: im in love with the game now. no auction house. you have to play to get a better gear. love it! im invincible with my wd!

snippet.textDisplay: I still play the game fairly regularly too since I started around the release date in May of 2012, grinding on my Wizard and Crusader primarily, and occasionally on my other characters. Loot 2.0 and Reaper of Souls were welcome changes to me since I hated the outrageously high prices people put up for items in the Auction House; The kind of money I could never get. Now, I can get Legendaries fairly easily, and thanks to my Boon of the Hoarder Legendary Gem, I now have enough gold to craft as many gems and items as I please while farming on Torment 1.
snippet.textOriginal: I still play the game fairly regularly too since I started around the release date in May of 2012, grinding on my Wizard and Crusader primarily, and occasionally on my other characters. Loot 2.0 and Reaper of Souls were welcome changes to me since I hated the outrageously high prices people put up for items in the Auction House; The kind of money I could never get. Now, I can get Legendaries fairly easily, and thanks to my Boon of the Hoarder Legendary Gem, I now have enough gold to craft as many gems and items as I please while farming on Torment 1.

snippet.textDisplay: @Hallow Knight Don't make me laugh. I thought Act V's storyline was amazing compared to Act I-IV. The audio and soundtracks were very well done, and the visuals and enviorments I got to see were breathtaking compared to the other acts, my favorite being the Pandemonium Fortress. I really loved Reaper of Souls.
